Comments_List: A basic understanding of the conduct of qualitative research.
An amazing and extensive knowledge on how to conduct qualitative research in nursing science
This course was a great introduction to qualitative research.  I learned the fundamentals and have a great base for additional learning opportunities.
I enjoyed the guest lectures and the custom nature of the assignments. I would recommend that the readings expand beyond perinatal, women's health, and pediatric topics.

This is a course that will force you to put a different researcher hat on :) It provides a great understanding on what GOOD qualitative research is like, and guides students through the various aspects of qualitative data collection and analysis. 
The readings can be a bit lengthy...which really does become more difficult (or pressuring) towards the end of the semester.

Very well organized, thorough, concrete without being too simplified.  I liked the power point overview that was used as a basis for discussion and incorporations of the reading.  The reading was well selected, and the exemplar papers were very informative.
yes, I think all MD researchers should take this course
Yes.  It was an excellent course.
